result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin L McCowan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 8/6/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Report in Date:  Monday, AUGUST 11, 2014. If defendant fails to report, all community access is cancelled.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin L McCowan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.  10 days HOC, consecutive.  Due & owing.
DENYING, request to reinstate huber privileges.  Order signed and filed.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to reinstate Huber privileges.

Defendant Melvin L McCowan in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.

Report in Date:  Monday, AUGUST 11, 2014.
If defendant fails to report, all community access is cancelled.

- Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 8/6/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Sentencing Referral Form.  aw

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols (THC), contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(e).  A unclassified misdemeanor.  aw

Defendant Melvin L McCowan in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case set for trial.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8/6/2014 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 9/3/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court reminds parties to file all final pretrial documents by the next court date.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melvin L McCowan in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests time to go over discovery.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/10/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Melvin L McCowan in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melvin L McCowan in court.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Notice Of Appearance For Counsel by Attorney Edward Wright Jr. for Attorney Robert Webb Jr.
Received and Filed, Motion To Adjourn Preliminary Hearing by Attorney Edward Wright Jr. for Attorney Robert Webb Jr.

The Court ordered No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Melvin L McCowan in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 04/09/2014 @ 1:00pm
